topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example 2: Create a Cluster

section.p: The following is an example on how to create a cluster with a Core node, two DEAs and a MySql service

ol.li: Save this content in a text file named bootstrap.yml constructor-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My prefix> dea-count: 2 dea-flavor: standard.medium services: mysql services-on-core: false service-flavor: standard.medium az: <my az>Please ensure the values for image names, image sizes and availability zones ("az") are valid for your current configuration.

Run the following set of commands. cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url https://region-a.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v2.0/ ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ create-cluster ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --admin-email <admin email> ^ --admin-password <admin password> ^ --max-cluster-wait-duration -1 ^ --max-corenode-wait-duration -1 ^ --load bootstrap.yml

section.note: A value of -1 indicates an infinite duration.
